name: R.B.I. Baseball 15
description: The legendary Major League Baseball franchise returns to the diamond. Make History.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, 7, 8 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Geforce 9500GT DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 6 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible Additional Notes: Requires two gamepads for local multiplayer

reviews.review_text: This is a nice game. It's a retro style Baseball game with an arcade feel to it. The graphics are decent; not over the top, and not bad either. It's good to see an MLB game on the PC.   Positives: A Baseball game back on the PC Works with a Logitech Dual Action Controller, however some of the controls don't match up; hit is button 1, bunt button 2, steal button 3 (and direction). All of those controls are easy to use though. :) Pitching and hitting are fun Season mode with stats Choice of 162 games in a season, 82, or 51. (Yes season mode appears to work now so far. the relief pitcher bug is now fixed. :) MLB rosters Sounds of the crowd are pretty good, they cheer when they should; sounds cool when someone hits a homerun as well Games can be played in a reasonable amount of time. I lost 6-2 in my first season game and it lasted around 45 minutes. It took me 1-2 exhibition games to get used to the controls, but they are pretty good.  Minus: Fielding is a bit tough at first, but you can set it on assist which means the fielders do the fielding and you do the throwing if needed. Graphics could be better No Myplayer, and no trades.  Mouse control in the menus (or at all) isn't supported; have to use keyboard or gamepad. There are a few bugs I ran into like a pitcher fielding the ball in the 12th on the mound, and he couldn't throw or move. This only happened once so far though.  Overall: Pick up this game if you want a decent MLB game, and you want to support PC sports games.

Very good game. It´s an arcade game not a simulator as OOTP. I´m enjoyng it. Warning: it really requires an Xbox controller (you can play with keyboard, but it´s very difficult).  If you put as field assisted (or something like that) it gets easier to get the ball in the field.  Roster with actual players.  You can play season with different lenghts, many configurations, different stadium. A casual game to enjoy. Bought it on a promotion.
Pretty fun classic game. I enjoy it. Not as deep as The Show or anything like that. Good arcade baseball game that improves from last years version. Fielding is really hard though.

How I wish we had a full blown baseball game on PC. If you want one, this is not the game you are looking for, BUT if you are looking for a simple arcade baseball for fun, a way to spend some time, lamenting on the licensing deals that destroyed sport simulator genre on PC, this is a very nice game for it.  Seriously though, while R.B.I. Baseball is far from MLB The Show, or MLB 2k12 (which I still play frequently), it is still kinda fun. And, I hope it is the step towards finally getting a full baseball sim on PC.

With the September update my game works great. I am looking forward to 2016 and hope it continues. I know this was a work in progress but the bugs are worked out. This is really the ONLY game out there worth getting for baseball in Steam.

I'll start with saying that I remember the original RBI baseball. The gameplay in a singleplayer session of RBI 2015 is largely on par with that experience, which is okay. There are a lot of additions I want in the singlepalyer experience, but I it wasn't lacking anything it promised on that front. So if you want a singleplayer experience, it will probably be okay for you. Not too many bugs.  That all being said, I wanted a game with good multiplayer. What I got was a game with TERRIBLE multiplayer support. - The games frequently don't start - games crash out with regularity, and can't be resumed - When pitching; the baserunner icons on the HUD disappear with disturbing regularity (multiple times per game) - when batting: if the opposing teams pitch hits my batter, but I've started a late swing it counts as a strike. This is bad because the animation only looks like I've lifted my leg, not made any swing motion - sometimes when fielding the ball, I can't throw it. Play literally will not progress to the next batter until all base runners are sent home - fielding is terrible. I can't seem to allow the AI to control that in multiplayer, where there is an option in singleplayer.

Highly Recommend these guys have kepts true to RBI roots. I am wish they had teams from yore. One can dream for an expansion pack. I really like the control scheme of this game I have seen others complain about. I guess you cant please everyone. 5 star rating from me very impressed!!!!!!!!!!
All i can say - the game is bad. Better to play MLB 2k12 Baseball with some mods. Really sad spending my 20 euros for this sh...t ...
If you played R.B.I Baseball on the frist Nintendo then your going to love this game even more! but if your new keep an open mind it's a great game!

The graphics are a little better but other then that, just get your 1st Gen Nintendo out and play baseball on that, it's a lot more fun. This is not made for the PC, it's just ported for it (the PC) and not very good at all, in fact, it's a terrible port. The controls are dismal at best, gameplay and physics seem right out of the 70s-80s arcades where you pop in a coin and play. This is a dollar store game at best, where no item costs more then 1 dollar.

I really want to like this game. I love baseball and I love video games, but this game is way too glitchy. Even for the casual gamer. I waited until it went on sale for $10. I bought it and had a good time for a few games. And then the glitches started happening. I thought that I could ignore the small things in hopes of playing a baseball video game when I bought it. Turns out I can't. Frustrating. I hate to be mean, but please save your money if you are considering buying this game. Even for 10 bucks. Not worth it.
I'm not going to talk bad about this game, but arcade-style baseball just isn't for me.  Not since MLB Slugfest 2003.
This games controlling method for keyboard is HORRIBLE. A controller is a must have for this title.
